metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11412 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 4.13 through 4.16.11, ext4_read_inline_data() infs/ext4/inline.c performs a memcpy with an untrusted length value incertain circumstances involving a crafted filesystem that stores thesystem.data extended attribute value in a dedicated inode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-33-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-33-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-33-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-33-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-33-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-azure - 4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-gcp - 4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
